subject: Learning
title: Rereading: The Illusion of Learning
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Rereading: The Illusion of Learning.

hook.text: You read the chapter twice and feel prepared. The exam says otherwise.

buildup.text: Rereading is the most common study strategy and one of the least effective.

discovery.text: It creates fluency illusionâ€”the text feels familiar, so you assume you've learned it.

twist.text: Recognition isn't recall. Recognizing an answer on the page is easy; producing it from memory is hard.

climax.text: Self-testing beats rereading by a wide margin. Struggle during practice means strength during the test.

punchline.text: Rereading feels productive. Testing feels hard. Hard wins.

quiz.question: Why is rereading an ineffective study strategy?
options: It creates an illusion of knowledge through familiarity, not true recall
